questions.question_text: Which two features can be enabled to support asymmetric routing with redundancy on a Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewall (NGFW)? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
Explanation:

 Active/Active High Availability (HA):
 Active/Active HA enables both firewalls in an HA pair to process traffic simultaneously. This setup supports scenarios like asymmetric routing, where return traffic might not follow the same path. In such cases, both firewalls are aware of the session state.

 Non-SYN First Packet:
 This feature allows the firewall to handle and create sessions for non-SYN packets. In asymmetric routing, the first observed packet might not be a SYN packet because the SYN could have been processed by another firewall. Enabling this ensures session establishment and proper handling of such traffic.

Incorrect Options:

 A. Multiple Virtual Systems:
 This is used for segmentation and multi-tenancy, not for asymmetric routing.

 D. Asymmetric Routing Profile:
 There is no specific "asymmetric routing profile" feature in Palo Alto Networks firewalls. Instead, asymmetric routing is supported by configuring features like Active/Active HA and enabling non-SYN first packet processing.

Selected Answer: B
BC are correct
Due to the fact that two answer should be selected, it must be B and C

Selected Answer: C
C seems correct as well.

Selected Answer: A
I say A is the correct one because private WildFire appliance automatically deploy protection across local next-generation firewalls.
I discard:
B- Private and public cloud generate malware reports.
C- The WF engine (private or cloud) do the analysis in different OS.
D- WF appliance can also generate AV and DNS signatures, also URL categories.

Selected Answer: A
A is correct

Selected Answer: C
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-wildfire/administration/advanced-wildfire-overview/advanced-wildfire-subscription

WildFire private cloud analysis does not support APK, Mac OS X, Linux (ELF), archive (RAR/7-Zip), and script (JS, BAT, VBS, Shell Script, PS1, and HTA) files

Selected Answer: D
Private WF, doesn't update DNS an URL db.

questions.question_text: What is an advantage public cloud WildFire has over the private WildFire appliance?

choices.A: signatures being available within minutes to protect global users once malware has been submitted
choices.D: generating antivirus and domain name system (DNS) signatures for discovered malware and assigning a Uniform Resource Locator (URL) category to malicious links
choices.C: using different types of operating systems (OSs) to test malware against

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is correct. https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/pan-os/9-1/pan-os-admin/threat-prevention/set-up-file-blocking

questions.question_text: Which action can prevent users from unknowingly downloading potentially malicious file types from the internet?

choices.C: Assign a Vulnerability profile to Security policy rules that deny general web access.
choices.B: Apply a Zone Protection profile to the untrust zone.
choices.A: Apply a File Blocking profile to Security policy rules that allow general web access.
choices.D: Assign an Antivirus profile to Security policy rules that deny general web access.

questions.question_text: Which two of the following does decryption broker provide on a NGFW? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Decryption broker allows you to offload SSL decryption to the Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewall and decrypt traffic only once
choices.D: Decryption broker allows you to offload SSL decryption to the Palo Alto Networks next-generation firewall and decrypt traffic multiple times
choices.B: Eliminates the need for a third party SSL decryption option which allows you to reduce the total number of third party devices performing analysis and enforcement
choices.C: Provides a third party SSL decryption option which allows you to increase the total number of third party devices performing analysis and enforcement

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AB
C is wrong because it's not a third party and D is wrong because it's done to avoid decryption multiple time

questions.question_text:
A potential customer requires an NGFW solution that enables high-throughput, low-latency network security and also inspects the application.
Which aspect of the Palo Alto Networks NGFW capabilities should be highlighted to help address these requirements?
